page.title: 01Farmland Around Gladsmuir
page.content: The area is generally flat and open with good quality farm land producing annual crops of wheat, barley and potatoes. There is some pasture land around Penston with sheep and cattle. it has numerous smallwoods and the larger Buterden Wood recently saved from the plough. The area is bisected by the A1 Trunk Road on which sits the village of Gladsmuir. To the north large grain merchants stores and a transport depot are found next to Elveinston House with its woods and park. Further west the Macmerry Industrial Estate also faces the A1 road. the remains of a wartime military airfield can still be seen in the fields around at the farming hamlet of Penston to the south.
